problem_text: Given that UT = TV and m \angle PQS = 42, find m \angle VTS.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠BQA, ∠QSR, T on QS, ∠TQA, 3.14 = pi, RV ⊥ TV, TU, PU ⊥ TU, ∠TUA, QU, U on AQ, S on BQ, ∠SQA, QV ⊥ TV, P on AQ, QT, TU = TV, ∠QUT, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQP, RS ⊥ RV, QU ⊥ TU, P on AU, T on BQ

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠QSR, T on QS
Conclusions: ∠QSR = ∠TSR

Step 3:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : PU ⊥ TU
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TUP

Step 4:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠TQA, U on AQ
Conclusions: ∠TQA = ∠TQU

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BQA, S on BQ
Conclusions: ∠BQA = ∠SQA

Step 6:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QV ⊥ TV
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TVQ

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠SQA, P on AQ
Conclusions: ∠SQA = ∠SQP

Step 8:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : QT, QU, TU
Conclusions: △QTU

Step 9:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠TUA, ∠QUT
Conclusions: pi = ∠QUT + ∠TUA

Step 10:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Parallel
Premises : RV ⊥ TV, RS ⊥ RV
Conclusions: RS || VT

Step 11:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QU ⊥ TU
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠QUT

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠TUA, P on AU
Conclusions: ∠TUA = ∠TUP

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BQA, T on BQ
Conclusions: ∠BQA = ∠TQA

Step 14:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQP, ∠SQA = ∠SQP
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQA

Step 15:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(U, T, Q)
Premises : △QTU
Conclusions: pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠QUT + ∠TUA
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TUA

Step 17:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : RS || VT
Conclusions: ∠QSR = ∠QTV

Step 18:
Theorem: Consecutive Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : RS || VT
Conclusions: pi = ∠TSR + ∠VTS

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠QUT, pi / 2 = ∠TVQ
Conclusions: ∠QUT = ∠TVQ

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠TUP, pi / 2 = ∠QUT, ∠TUA = ∠TUP
Conclusions: ∠QUT = ∠TUA

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQA = ∠SQA, ∠BQA = ∠TQA
Conclusions: ∠SQA = ∠TQA

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QSR = ∠QTV, ∠QSR = ∠TSR
Conclusions: ∠QTV = ∠TSR

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠TSR + ∠VTS
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠TSR + ∠VTS

Step 25:
Theorem: Hypotenuse-Leg Congruent Theorem
Premises : ∠QUT = ∠TVQ, TU = TV
Conclusions: △QTU ≅ △QTV

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQA, ∠SQA = ∠TQA
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQA

Step 27:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △QTU ≅ △QTV
Conclusions: ∠QUT = ∠TVQ, ∠QTV = ∠UTQ

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠TQA = ∠TQU, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQA
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQU

Step 29:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ, pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ, ∠QUT = ∠TUA, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQU, 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TUA
Conclusions: 0.84 = ∠UTQ

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QTV = ∠UTQ, 0.84 = ∠UTQ, ∠QTV = ∠TSR
Conclusions: 0.84 = ∠TSR

Step 31:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 0.84 = ∠TSR, 3.14 = ∠TSR + ∠VTS
Conclusions: 2.3 = ∠VTS
